IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO ADVANCE PROFESSIONAL, LITERARY, AND SCIENTIFIC UNDERSTANDING OF SEA POWER.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO ADVANCE PROFESSIONAL, LITERARY, AND SCIENTIFIC KNOWLEDGE IN THE NAVAL AND MARITIME SCIENCES, AND THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE KNOWLEDGE OF SEA POWER.
IRS990.Desc: PUBLISHING COSTS - INCLUDES COSTS OF PRODUCING PROCEEDINGS AND NAVAL HISTORY: TWO MAGAZINES WHICH FEATURE DIVERSE ARTICLES FROM NAVAL PROFESSIONALS AND CIVILIAN EXPERTS AND FEATURE HISTORICAL ESSAYS AND CURRENT TOPICS. ALSO INCLUDED IN PUBLISHING COSTS IS THE COST OF PRODUCING NAVAL REVIEW, AN EXPANDED EDITION OF PROCEEDINGS INCLUDING AN ANNUAL REFERENCE GUIDE TO THE NAVAL SERVICES. ADDITIONALLY, THE INSTITUTE ALSO PUBLISHES SEVERAL HUNDRED BOOKS. THE TITLES RANGE FROM HOW-TO BOOKS ON BOATING AND NAVIGATION TO BATTLE HISTORIES, BIOGRAPHIES, SHIP AND AVIATION GUIDES, PAPERBACK WORKS OF FICTION AND NON-FICTION, AND PROFESSIONAL MANUALS. ADDITIONALLY E-BOOK VERSIONS OF SELECTED BOOKS HAVE NOW BEEN MADE AVAILABLE.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: CONFERENCE EXPENSES - THE INSTITUTE PROVIDES FOR VARIOUS SEMINARS AND MEETINGS THROUGHOUT ITS FISCAL YEAR, ON CURRENT AND HISTORICAL TOPICS. THESE MEETINGS OFFER A CONCENTRATED OPPORTUNITY FOR THE EXCHANGE OF IDEAS AND DISCUSSIONS OF KEY NAVAL ISSUES AMONG NAVAL PROFESSIONALS AND OTHERS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: ROYALTIES - REPRESENT VARIOUS PROJECTS UNDERTAKEN TO FURTHER SCIENTIFIC, PROFESSIONAL, AND LITERARY KNOWLEDGE OF SEA POWER AND THE MARITIME SERVICES.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: SPECIAL PROJECTS - REPRESENT VARIOUS PROJECTS UNDERTAKEN TO FURTHER SCIENTIFIC, PROFESSIONAL, AND LITERARY KNOWLEDGE OF SEA POWER AND THE MARITIME SERVICES.

OtherLiabilitiesOrgGrp.Desc: DUE TO THE NAVAL INSTITUTE FOUNDATION

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE INSTITUTE'S FOUNDATION ALLOCATES THE INVESTMENT INCOME GENERATED BY THE ENDOWMENT EACH YEAR BASED ON THE PURPOSE OF THE ENDOWMENT AS PROVIDED BY THE DONOR. IF THE DONOR DOES NOT SPECIFY A PURPOSE FOR THE INCOME GENERATED FROM THEIR PERMANENTLY RESTRICTED ENDOWMENT, THE INCOME IS USED FOR GENERAL SUPPORT AND IS DISTRIBUTED ANNUALLY.

THE INSTITUTE ADOPTED THE GUIDANCE FOR ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES. MANAGEMENT HAS DETERMINED THAT THE INSTITUTE HAS NO MATERIAL UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT WOULD REQUIRE RECOGNITION UNDER THE GUIDANCE.
COSTS OF GOODS SOLD 1,484,177. REVENUE OF SUPPORTING ORGANIZATION 1,964,927.
COSTS OF GOODS SOLD 1,484,177. EXPENSES OF SUPPORTING ORGANIZATION 917,291.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MEMBERS VOTE FOR THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. THE INSTITUTE SHALL HAVE MEMBERS, LIFE MEMBERS, GOLDEN LIFE MEMBERS, AND OTHER SUCH MEMBERSHIPS THAT THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS MAY APPROVE FROM TIME TO TIME. MEMBERSHIP, LIFE MEMBERSHIP, AND GOLDEN LIFE MEMBERSHIP SHALL BE OPEN TO ALL U.S. AND FOREIGN CITIZENS WHO ARE INTERESTED IN THE MISSION OF THE INSTITUTE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE MEMBERS VOTE FOR THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS ON AN ANNUAL BASIS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: IN ADDITION TO ELECTING THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS ON AN ANNUAL BASIS, MEMBERS MUST APPROVE AN AMENDMENT TO THE CONSTITUTION AND BYLAWS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 IS COMPLETED ON AN ANNUAL BASIS WITH COPIES BEING PROVIDED TO THE ENTIRE GOVERNING BOARD AS WELL AS THE CEO OF THE ORGANIZATION. AT THAT TIME THE CEO WILL REVIEW THE FORM 990 WITH THE CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER AND SOLICIT ANY CHANGES FROM THE GOVERNING BOARD. ONCE ALL THE NECESSARY CHANGES ARE MADE AND THE CEO AND THE GOEVERNING BOARD ARE IN AGREEMENT ON THE FINISHED FORM 990, IT WILL BE SIGNED BY THE CFO, DATED AND SUBMITTED BY THE FILING DEADLINE. A FINAL COPY OF THE APPROVED FORM 990 WILL BE PROVIDED TO ALL OFFICERS AND DIRECTORS BEFORE THE RETURN IN FILED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: OFFICERS, DIRECTORS AND KEY EMPLOYEES MUST ANNUALLY SIGN A STATEMENT THAT THEY HAVE READ AND UNDERSTAND ALL USNI POLICIES. PENALTY FOR NON COMPLIANCE OF ALL POLICIES IS NOTED AND INCLUDES UP TO TERMINATION FOR ANY VIOLATION. THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY IS DISTRIBUTED TO THE BOARD AT THE ANNUAL ORGANIZATIONAL MEETING AND THE DIRECTORS SIGN AND ACKNOWLEDGE THAT THEY HAVE READ AND UNDERSTOOD.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SALARY OF THE CEO IS DETERMINED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. THE SALARY OF THE CFO/COO IS DETERMINED BY THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE. THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE REVIEWS A SALARY SURVEY PERFORMED BY AN OUTSIDE VENDOR AND/OR THE HR DEPARTMENT AS PART OF DETERMINING COMPENSATION FOR THESE INDIVIDUALS. THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND COMPENSATION COMMITTEE CONTEMPORANEOUSLY DOCUMENT THE DELIBERATIONS AND DECISIONS REGARDING THE COMPENSATION ARRANGEMENTS FOR THE CEO AND CFO/COO.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GOVERNING DOCUMENTS: AVAILABLE TO MEMBERS ON THE WEBSITE, ALL OTHERS UPON REQUEST. CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY: UPON REQUEST FINANCIAL STATEMENTS: AVAILABLE TO MEMBERS ON THE WEBSITE, ALL OTHERS UPON REQUEST.

IdRelatedTaxExemptOrgGrp.PrimaryActivitiesTxt: RAISE FUNDS FOR CHARITABLE AND EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES
